intro: Hieracium ofotense, commonly known as the Otter Island hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to the British Isles. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellow daisy-like flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and riverbanks. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Hieracium ofotense is relatively small, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters, and is often found in coastal and wetland environments.
